Press Service
Sends a daily flow of 75,000 words of news and a monthly
average of 28,000 photo prints to USIS posts in 77 countries.
As part of this service, a daily press file is transmitted
by wireless for use in 55 countries by 10,000 foreign news
outlets. In addition, 75 million publications of all kinds
will be distributed in the year by the field posts, to be
read by hundreds of millions of persons# From pilot models
of pamphlets and other source materials prepared in Washington,
the field posts determine how many copies they require and
produce them locally and at regional centers#
Motion Picture Service
Prepares American documentary films in 22 languages. The
films are seen by hundreds of millions ci persons annually
through loans to private groups and public agencies# Maintains
some 6000 16mm sound projectors and over 300 mobile units.
In addition, many U, S, documentary films are exhibited through
commercial theaters abroad,as well as through an increasing
number of foreign television stations#
Information Center Service
Services 155 information centers in 63 countries which
conduct library programs and community activities such as
lectures, exhibits, and film showings based on the libraiy
collection. The average information center has from 7,000
to 10,000 volumes and the world-wide collection totals slightly
less than two million books# Twenty-nine bookmobiles extend
this service into remote areas in six countries. Several
comprehensive three-dimensional traveling exhibits are
constantly being moved from country to country for display
at U. S. Information Centers, These graphically supplement
the books and other reading material found in the Centers,
The service also is responsible for the translation and
distribution of American books overseas, and for the
Informational Media Guaranty Program# Formerly vested in
ECA and MSA, the latter program guarantees the convertibility
into dollars of foreign currencies received by American
publishers and motion-picture producers from the foreign
sale of their approved materials. Agreements to this effect
are now in force with nine countries, chiefly in Europe;
total contracts of $22 millions have bee:, guaranteed.
